definitions: To make a strong, vivid, or lasting impression on someone.
To produce or stamp a mark or design on a surface.
To fix an idea or fact firmly in someone's mind.
To compel (someone) to serve in the armed forces or public service.
examples: His performance will impress the judges.
The seal was used to impress the wax.
She tried to impress the importance of safety upon them.
Historically, sailors were sometimes impressed into service.
